comment._content:
Description should read:
Jun 1945. A Party of the K.A.R. on leave from Burma march down Delamere Avenue

Location: Nairobi, Kenya

comment.author: 30662496@N08
comment._content: I'm thinking this is Nairobi. Busia even at present doesn't look this way and their was a spelling mistake they're from leave from Burma.

comment.author: 59381151@N02
comment._content: This is actually present day Kenyatta avenue in Nairobi city! Some of the buildings still exist partly like the Stanley!

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content:
In the postcard below, Delamere Avenue/Kenyatta Avenue Nairobi (upper image)  as it was in the 1960s (taken from the roof of the Avenue Hotel-the one in the National Archives was probably taken from the same vantage point  :

 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00/3354104403/in/set-148350/]

comment.author: 59562007@N08
comment._content: This is a Government Photograph taken at the same time as a film  of early 1946 held in the Imperial War Museum Archive and readily traceable Subject is East African KAR Batallion on return from Burma Campaign

comment.author: 59375758@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00] How does one juxtapose a modern (or relatively recent) coloured photo under one of these historical black and white photos as you have done above?

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: Hi..you cut and paste the url for the image you want (from flickr) This is the one for the national archives image: www.flickr.com/photos/nationalarchives/5405251976/ then you put it in square brackets [ ] and it should then appear like this: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nationalarchives/5405251976/]

comment.author: 59375758@N06
comment._content: Jambo Paul - you're a genius.   Just done please refer to these Kenya series photos CO 1069-133-1 Part of CO 1069/133 thumbnails page 5 (the 2nd last photo from the right on the 2nd last row).

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: Well spotted...Imagine treckking across the bundu in those days..
